results.title: Fall line
results.creator_credit: Bob Carmichael, Greg Lowe and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: An exciting film of the high risk sport of extreme skiing. On a peak in Wyoming’s Grand Tetons a lone skier attempts the first climb and then the fall line - a breathtaking descent of the almost vertical slope. Awarded first prize, Sports, San Francisco International Film Festival. The skier is Steve Shea and the film has been narrated by Ron Hayes.

results.title: Big painter
results.brief_description: A chronological study of the production of a mural by John Firth-Smith begun in 1978 and completed in 1981. The huge painting measures 6m x 48m and hangs in the headquarters of the ANZ Bank, Melbourne.

results.title: Break down the barriers
results.creator_credit: Bill Latto, Queensland National Fitness Council and Town and Country Productions
results.brief_description: Illustrates how disabled people are breaking down the barriers which, until recently, often precluded their participation in any other than stereotyped recreational activities. Demonstrates such recreational activities as grass skiing, canoeing, lawn and ten pin bowling, swish, rifle shooting, scuba diving, hang gliding, disco and square dancing etc. Commentary by Stan Pretty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Latto, Queensland National Fitness Council and Town and Country Productions

results.title: Little By little: upgrading Barrio Escopa
results.creator_credit: Tina Viljoen, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In Manila, nearly one million people live in squatter settlements; living conditions vary from almost pleasant to appalling. Little by Little documents the attempt to upgrade a section of one such settlement, Barrio Escopa. The project takes all aspects of community life into account. The film examines the complex nature of urban redevelopment and the roles played by different government agencies in the project’s execution.

results.title: Olympics: the eternal torch
results.creator_credit: Dan Rose, Sam Summerlin, Associated Press and Oxford Films
results.brief_description: Uses footage dating back to 1896 and highlights taken from each Olympiad since, to trace American participation in the games. Shows the pageantry and traditions that make up this international institution.

results.title: Out of breath
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A dramatised documentary about occupational asthma. A cabinet maker is faced with the difficult choice between continuing to work in a dusty environment or improving his health.

results.title: Just like machines
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Instructs on safe methods of handling pesticides, their application and storage. Stresses that the Department of Agriculture should be contacted for advice as to which pesticide to use for which pest, when there is doubt as to identity. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: A Feeling of self worth
results.creator_credit: Robin Young and Victoria. Vandalism Task Force
results.brief_description: A feeling of self worth describes the approach taken at Monterey and the positive impact this has had on the school. Present and former staff and the parents of former students talk about the school as it used to be and the improvements that have been made.

results.title: Frankston Motor Cycle Park
results.creator_credit: Robin Young and Victoria. Vandalism Task Force
results.brief_description:
Trailbike riding causes damage to the environment and violence and aggravation between riders and local residents. This video was made to give councils, police and motor-cycle clubs some starting points and pointers towards developing their own locally appropriate solution.
Made in conjunction with the Frankston Police Community Involvement Programme and Frankston TAFE.
